Luna: *She punched Lance on the shoulder.* "Seriously?!"

Lance: *He pouted and looked down, holding his anger back.* "I-I'm sorry."

Leon: *He sighed, hiding his emotional pain.* "Everyone has emotional chains, sometimes we wrap them around our own necks, sometimes it's the people close to us holding them down. You need to surround yourself with the people that will pull you up by those chains, instead of the ones that add more weight to them. It doesn't matter how individually gifted one can be, it's the people that touch those chains which determine how high or low you can go."

Luna: "Nah-" *She shook her head with a mature smile on her face.* "My guild keeps me pulled up pretty high."

Leon: "Lance?"

Lance: "Aye?" *He spoke under his breath as if he started to reflect on his attitude.*

Luna: "Lance?" *She sounded caring while slightly leaning forward to look at his face.*

Lance: "I'm kool.. You have to understand, dad.. My life would have been so much better if you were in it." *He looked up, revealing his watering eyes.*

Leon: "..."

Lance: "You were so strong-" *He sniffed and looked down, triggering a flashback.*

Lance: "People who don't respect their parents are just-" *He looked around the room with his mouth open, unsure what to say.*

Alicia: "Unacceptable."

Lance: *He smiled in amazement, nodding his head.* "I look back at the way I treated you, and I feel so ashamed."

Kairi: "Leon was a powerful man, I was also hurt..."

Lance: "..."

Kairi: "Out of all-" *She paused, resting her cup on the table due to her shaking fingers.* "Out of all the ways to leave us, he went like that." *Her carefree, happy-like attitude disappeared, as she looked at Lance, speaking in a different tone.*

Lance: (I haven't heard her talk like that before.)

Kairi: "You weren't the only one who was grieving, Lance. I needed to put on a happy attitude to try and make things better."

Alicia: "S-Sometimes it's better to grieve together, support each other. You two could obviously understand the pain you were experiencing, so there was no reason to hide it."

Kairi: "..."

Alicia: "Family should be important-" *She paused and frowned, shaking her head in a correcting manner.* "Family is important!"

*Alicia spoke in recollection, glancing at both Lance and Kairi.*

Alicia: "They're there to compensate for your weaknesses and to compliment your strengths, together, that's what it means to be family."

?????: "What is happening here?!"

Warrior: "Who? That's my question!"

Kairi: "Exactly."

Leon: "Gotcha." *He gritted his teeth and held Kairi's hand, frowning in determination.* "We're on the same page."

Kairi: "What are you doing? Fight him-"

*Lance and Luna gasped, staring at Leon speechless.*

Lance: (I'm going to be really annoyed if I find myself wakin' up or something-)

Lance: *Tears of happiness ran down his face.* "Y-Yeah."

Lance: "Th-Thanks, dad." *He spoke with quivering lips as if Leon's words meant a lot to him.*

Luna: *She whimpered and nodded her head, trying to wipe away the tears.* "Yes."

Luna: "You too." *She looked up, causing her tears to drip off her cheeks.*

Lance: *He rubbed Luna's arm, causing her to lean on his chest.* "Wow-"

Luna: "Y-Yeah." *She sniffed, trying to keep her composure.*

*The crystal in their hand disintegrated into a pulse of green dust.*

Lance: *A smile consumed his face.* "Thanks, Luna."

Luna: *She sniffed with a smile and leant up.* "What for?"

Lance: "That we got to see that."

Luna: *She smiled and nodded her head.* "Thank you, too." *She stood up and wiped the tears off her face.*

Lance: *He heard footsteps leave the inn, causing him to stand up.* "I personally think we should have a few more minutes, but I'm tired of keeping everyone waitin'."

Luna: "I agree."

Lance: *He smiled in a mature manner, facing the door.* "Let's go."

Luna: "Yeah."

*Lance and Luna smiled at each other before walking out of the room.*

Luna: "Home?"

Lance: "You know, Dee Highs."

Luna: *She paused and shook her head.* "I can't go back."

Lance: "Huh? Why?" *He opened the door, causing morning air to brush against their faces.*

Luna: "When I had the opportunity to go back. My eyes no longer worked."

Lance: "Oh." *He mumbled in disappointment.* "How come?" *He awkwardly asked.*

Luna: "Because Destiny was either unable to enter the Spacial Funnel, or, she went into a deep dormant-like state."

Lance: "So, that means you were blind?"

Luna: "That's what people usually mean if they say their eyes don't work." *She smiled, hiding her disappointment.*

Lance: "Oh." *He awkwardly smiled, watching the large cluster of party and guild members wait around a massive purple glyph.*

Luna: *She slowly walked across Surpreon's central towards the party.* "Could you please tell mum that I love her, and I miss her, too?"

Lance: "You didn't even have to ask." *He spoke as if he was already going to tell her that.*

Luna: "Thanks."

Lance: "Anytime, aye."

Luna: "When did you get so mature?"

Lance: "Probably around the same time you actually became fun to talk to."

Luna: "Pssht." *She smiled and walked up to the guild, catching their attention.*

Lezard: "Look at us, we're all matching in uniform! It feels like we're getting ready for school, bwarharh!"

PKMY: "Took your bloody time!"

PKMY: "Wat-?!"

Teresa: "Indeed. It is time for us to go to Silver Wind Island."

Rachael: "Until next time.."
Celest: "Thy will always think of thou, Aliciana-"

Locki: "May the Astragons lead you to a safe journey."

Alicia: *She smiled at Locki and Celest.* "Th-Thank you."

Holland: "Lance, I see you as a brother, and brothers always stick together. So, I'll always think of you too."

Lance: *He stepped closer to the Spacial Funnel and looked shocked.* "Y-You too, bro."

Luna: *He glanced at Holland, raising an eyebrow in confusion.* "So, are we like related now?"

Holland: "Haha."

Luna: *She smiled and looked at Rachael.* "Who would've thought?"

Rachael: *She stared at Ashton's transparent figure.* (Ashton-?)

Destiny: *She suddenly appeared in a flash of purple light, floating up into the air.* (Something doesn't feel right?)

Luna: *She slightly shuffled her feet as if she was readjusting her perception.* (Wat the eff are you doin'?!)

Destiny: (Her Neurons and Astragons! There's something strange!)

Ashton: *He smiled and watched Lance and Alicia step through the Spacial Funnel.* (You finally became the person I always saw in you.)

Rachael: *Her eyes watered as she continued her fixated stare on Ashton.* (Ash-)

Luna: *She looked puzzled and glanced in the direction Rachael stared at.* "R-Rach, there's nothin' there-?"

Rachael: *She gasped and shook her head.* "What?"

Luna: (She sad about my bro? You're probably seein' her emotions, aye.) *She chuckled.* "Don't worry."

Destiny: "Yeup." *She hovered over Luna's shoulder, staring at Rachael in a concerned manner.*

Lance: "I'm really glad to have met every single one of you." *He stepped into the Spacial Funnel before anyone could respond, as tears streamed down his cheeks.*

Alicia: "I wouldn't be the person I am today without all of your influence." *She stood next to Lance, looking at him with an emotional smile.*

Holland: "Oh, crud-" *He quickly wiped under his eyes, preventing tears from running down his face.*

Lance: *He looked over his shoulder and stared at the party, watching their image warp.* (I'll never forget about you.)

Alicia: *She noticed Lance's tears sparkle in the warping light around them, causing her to tighten her grip around his hand.* "I will miss them too."

Madora: *She sighed in relief, watching the Spacial Funnel close up behind her.* "Phew-" (I don't think I'd be able to keep doing this for much longer..)

Teresa: "A large sense of disappointment has filled my body?"

Pepper: *She ran her fingers through her hair, nodding her head in agreement.* "Yeah?"

Season: "..."

Holland: "The party awkwardly stared at each other?" *He sniffed and chuckled at himself, causing the party to chuckle too.*

PKMY: "S-So, what now?"

Holland: "Umm." *He hummed in thought, scratching under his chin.*

Tyler: "I-I wouldn't know where to start."

Locki: "The mistress wanted thou to act out your roles as soon as possible."

Tyler: *He glanced at Locki, sighing to himself in understanding.* "So, after all this, we'll be splitting ways?"

Pepper: *She nodded her head in agreement.* "I say, the sooner we're on our feet, the sooner we could possibly meet up again."

Teresa: "That is the best possible action I believe we could take." *She glanced at each party member.*

Locki: "But regarding Tyler-" *He glanced at Season in a curious manner.* "Since it was your announcement, Season-"

Season: "Say no more. I wouldn't dare dump the title on Tyler without helping him."

Locki: *He smiled.* "Excellent."

PKMY: *She wiped her eyes and sniffed.* "Let's get goin' eh?" *She pointed in front of her like a child, causing the party's dampened mood to brighten.*

Tyler: (Lance, Alicia, I will miss you both-)

----------

Lance: *Dark colours violently swirled around him, as strong winds blew in all directions.* (I'm still not feelin' good-)

Alicia: *She stared in front and noticed a door of light.* (It's getting bigger-)

Lance: "Brace yourself!" *The winds muffled his voice as the door of light blinded him.*

*Alicia and Lance gasped and took a large step forward, as sunlight shined brightly in their faces.*

Alicia: *She glanced around with uncertainty.* (That was a bumpy Spacial Funnel-)

Lance: *He inhaled deeply and sighed with a smile.* "I feel better."

Alicia: *She grabbed onto Lance's arm with both hands.* "W-We're home?"

Lance: *He looked down the street and smiled, nodding his head.* "Yea, we're home."

Alicia: "Tee hee. Dee Highs.."

Lance: *He smirked and faced Alicia.* "Thank you."

Alicia: "For what?"

Lance: "Well-" *He awkwardly looked away.*

Alicia: "For what?" *She stamped her foot, pretending to be mad.*

Lance: "For givin' me the will to live."

Alicia: *She looked at him in shock.* "R-Really?"

Lance: "I wouldn't say somethin' like that if I didn't-"

Alicia: *She stood on her toes and kissed Lance on the lips.* "Be quiet."

Lance: "O-OK." *He wrapped his arms around her and looked in front, staring at his house.* "To a new start?"

Alicia: "T-To a new start!" *She smiled in his arms, taking a deep breath.*

Chapter 26: Closured Paths

PKMY: *She stood in an enormous ball-like room and smirked, staring at herself in a body length mirror.* (Things are going smoothly-)

*PKMY stared at her hair which was tucked under her divine, warrior-like robes.*

PKMY: (All the stuff I had to do-)

*Faint holy-like music played in the background, giving a sense of royalty to the room.*

PKMY: (I thought it would've been harder, but actually it wasn't.) *She reached behind her neck and flicked her long red hair down to her shoulder-blades.*

*Footsteps loudly echoed into and across the room towards PKMY, catching her attention.*

PKMY: *She stared at the mirror and noticed a man in royal uniform stop behind her.* "Report?"

Warrior: *He kneeled down to one knee and lowered his head.* "All the villagers in the backwater village accepted your offer for work."

PKMY: *She smiled at herself in the mirror and spun around, admiring the long green dress she wore.* "Excellent, keep up the good work."

Warrior: "Y-You're too kind, Consultant."

PKMY: "If you've finished all your reports, you're free to take the day off."

Warrior: *He looked up and gasped in excitement.* "I-I can spend time with my f-family?"

PKMY: "Leave before I change my mind."

Warrior: "R-Right away! Thank you!" *He quickly stood up and ran out the room.*

PKMY: *She glanced at the jewellery on her fingers and around her neck.* (Just because I overestimated how hard this would've been, it didn't change the fact how much work was needed to actually get here-)

*Several metallic bangs followed by a child's squeal caught PKMY's attention.*

PKMY: *She frowned, staring at an enormous wooden cabinet.* "Theodore, didn't I tell you not to go near the warrior's armour!?"

Theodore: *He slowly staggered out of the polished cabinet, with a warrior's helmet which loosely covered his head.* "S-Sorry, mummy."

PKMY: *She stepped back and faced Theodore.* "Is this how a two year old should act?" *She grunted in a frustrated manner.*

Theodore: *He slowly took off the helmet, revealing his bright red hair.* "S-Sorry, mummy."

PKMY: "If you're going to be a warrior, then you-" *She flicked her head on a side and her image disappeared.*

Theodore: *He stepped back in shock, causing the armour to rattle.* "M-Mummy-?"

PKMY: *She reappeared behind him with a smirk.* "-Need a shield!" *She spread her arms and tickled him under the arms.*

Theodore: "Hehe, mummy! Stop!"

Freya: *She appeared in a flash of purple light, catching PKMY's attention.* "Amy, and stinky."

PKMY: "Frey." *She looked up with a warm smile.*

Theodore: "I-I'm not stinky!"

Freya: "I recall your odour being very distinctive."

Theodore: "N-Nawh." *He pouted like a child, enthusiastically shaking his head.*

Holland: *He walked into the room and stopped, watching Freya and Theodore arguing.* (My family.) *He smirked to himself before noticing PKMY's dress.* (Wow, she's smoking-)

PKMY: "Wat's new, Frey?" *She smiled, focusing her attention to Freya.*

Freya: "I thought I encountered a man stealing."

PKMY: "Stealing?" *She spoke as if she was going to do something about it.*

Freya: "But actually, it was someone returning lost property."

PKMY: *She smiled, standing in a relaxed-like state.* "Nice-"

Holland: *He took several more steps into the room.* "Wow, look at this." *His deep voice caught PKMY, Freya and Theodore's attention.*

Theodore: "Daddy!"
Freya: "Holland!" *She looked to the side, wagging her tail in excitement.*

PKMY: "Holly." *She smiled and flashstepped in the air in front of him.*

Holland: *He caught PKMY in his arms and spun around.* "How are you, babe?"

PKMY: "Very good. I just completed all my tasks prematurely."

Holland: "Oh yeah."

Freya: "And what about us?" *She glanced at Theodore, who angrily nodded his head in agreement.*

Holland: "So, Amy-"

PKMY: "Yes?"

Holland: "Theo and Freya want attention. What should we do?"

PKMY: "Hmm? Perhaps tickle them until they die?"

Theodore: "H-Huh?" *He gasped in shock, lowering his arms in fear.*

Holland: "Sounds like another adventure." *He smirked in an evil-like manner and lowered PKMY, slowly walking towards Theodore.*

PKMY: "Yea, sounds like fun." *She frowned with a smile, causing Freya and Theodore to slightly step back.*

Holland: "Before we attack you, how is Valhalla, Freya?"

Freya: "Everything is running fine. I've had no incidences with any non-Radiaton beings."

Holland: "Excellent." (I was fearing non-divine people would run amuck in Valhalla-)

PKMY: "Holly?"

Holland: "Yes-" *He smirked and stepped forward, suddenly sprinting towards Freya at incredible speeds.*

PKMY: *She flashstepped above Theodore, causing her long hair and dress to flap in the air.* "Yahoo!" *She dived down and spread her arms, bear hugging Theodore.*

Holland: *He jumped up and tackled Freya.* "If you increase your body size, you lose!"

Freya: "N-No fair!"

*Freya, PKMY, Theodore and Holland's laughter echoed throughout the room and down a massive hallway outside.*

*Tyler and Ginger walked through Surpreon's markets with a sense of authority.*

Ginger: *She looked around in an impressed manner and sighed.* "Ey, Tyler. The Battling Oxident we just co-hosted between our cities was one of the best ideas I have encountered in a long time."

Tyler: *He typed buttons on a digital tablet, nodding his head in agreement.* "It was your resources that assisted me in the development of my plans."

Ginger: *She walked with Tyler towards his manor.* "So, are there any more reports? Please respond."

Tyler: "No." *He looked up and inhaled in accomplishment.*

Ginger: "No?" *She grunted in an annoyed manner.*

Tyler: "Everyone is done, including my project."

Ginger: "Expanding the city's size?"

Tyler: *He looked to his side and stared into another sphere-like central.* "Yes. And to top it all off, everything has succeeded my action plans."

Ginger: *She discreetly looked shocked.* (Like my guild members, he chose illogical actions and ended up succeeding against all odds.) *She shook her head in disbelief, catching Tyler's attention.*

Tyler: "What is it?"

Ginger: "It is nothing-"

Man: *He swept dirt off the ground with his broom and noticed Tyler walking past him, causing him to instantly stop.* "Ah, Tyler. What a lovely day we're having!" *He bowed in excitement and respect.*

Tyler: *He smiled and nodded his head, stepping up several stairs to his manor.* "Indeed it is."

Man: *He smiled and looked at his wife and child.* "The ruler just smiled at me!" *He mumbled with excitement, causing his wife to smile.*

Ginger: "So, what is next on your plans?"

Tyler: "Next in my plans?"

Guard: *Two guards opened tall golden doors for Tyler and Ginger.* "Sir!"

Tyler: "Thank you."

Ginger: "Continue your great service." *She nodded her head to the guards as she entered the manor.*

Tyler: "Well-" *He placed the tablet under his arm and walked down the long red thin carpet.* "I want to somehow enable access to Battling Oxident from backwater villages."

Ginger: "Hermm? How illogical?"

Tyler: "Illogical?"

Ginger: "There would be no funds from those type of villages, please respond?!"

Tyler: "My logic is that people who are gifted are able to enter without worries of currency."

Ginger: "But what kind of gifted people live in backwater villages?"

Tyler: "For one example. Alicia."

Ginger: *Her eyes widened in shock and she shook her head.* "She has Radiatons. She could not have-"

Tyler: "Despite where she was from. She was raised in a backwater villager."

Ginger: *She gritted her teeth and hesitantly nodded her head.* "I have doubted your illogical ideas numerous times. I will support you one hundred percent."

Tyler: "Excellent."

Ginger: "When is this project coming into fruition?"

Tyler: "As we speak. I've already laid out the action plan and the time management expected to my researchers."

Ginger: "And their response?"

Tyler: "They've already given me prototypes of portable miniature glyphs, which connect to the main glyph of Battling Oxident."

Ginger: (He has already accomplished this?! I admire him for his intellect and initiative.) *She silently walked by his side, smiling to herself in thought.*

Tyler: "But, I have personal interests I'd like to research into myself."

Ginger: "Like what?"

Tyler: "Astragon or Astral Projections." *He walked through a solid door, causing water-like ripples to swirl around him.*

Ginger: "Not much is known about them." *She sounded annoyed as if he was wasting his time.*

Tyler: "Exactly."

*A line of warriors bowed down in front of Tyler's throne room, catching Ginger's attention.*

Ginger: "Are you expecting any guests?"

Tyler: "No." *He sounded intrigued.*

Ginger: *She looked at Tyler and then to the line of warriors.* "..."

Tyler: "Rise." *He spoke with a stern tone, causing the leader of the warriors to stand up and face him.*

Warrior: "Your majesty!"

Tyler: "Yes?"

Warrior: "We were dispatched by the Consultant to let you know something which sparked her interests."

Tyler: "Go on?"

Warrior: "It's about a recent number of Astral Projection sightings."

Tyler: "Oh?" *He looked to his side at Ginger with a smile.*

Warrior: "With your permission, I would like my party members to explain to you what was seen."

Tyler: "Of course."

Warrior: "Well-"

Ginger: *She stared at Tyler, who started to type on the tablet.* (He has things in complete order-) "I will head back to Silver Wind Island."

Tyler: *He looked at Ginger.* "Certainly. Thank you for your time."

Ginger: *She smiled and gracefully spun around.* "Any time."

Tyler: *He looked at Ginger and smiled in a loving manner.* "Once work is complete, I was thinking The Twilight Forest for tonight's date?" *He purposely lowered his voice, speaking to her in a casual manner.*

Ginger: "Affirmative." *She touched her arm and closed her eyes with a smile, disappearing in a flash of purple light.*

Tyler: *He glanced back to the warrior who stopped in mid-sentence.* "Please continue."

Warrior: "O-Of course."

*Season and Celest walked through a royal white castle with ancient pillars which connected the floor to the roof. *

Celest: "Thy remember one time, Tarlea was able to explode an Ancioldrant with three of her fingers." *She smirked, watching a flock of doves fly above cotton-like clouds.*

Season: "She was able to explode an Ancioldrant with her fingers?"

Celest: *She chuckled and continued to walk in a professional manner, causing her footsteps to sound like high-heels.* "She was a wonder."

Season: "She was." *He smiled with satisfaction.*

Celest: "Did thou know, there were even times when several members of The Wise tried to explain by facts how she was so abnormally powerful."

Season: "By facts?"

Celest: "They couldn't understand why she was so powerful."

Season: "Did they succeed? I'm curious to know myself."

Celest: *She shook her head and walked towards a large wall of glyphic, ancient-like drawings.* "No, they didn't."

Season: "Sounds like you have an idea yourself?"

Celest: "It's a simple theory. Thy personally believe she just tried her hardest every single time."

Season: "Not to sound rude, but that's a little absurd?"

Celest: "No. She tried her hardest no matter what she did."

Season: "Hmm?"

Celest: *She stopped in front of the wall and looked up, observing the drawings.* "From my point of view, she tried her hardest, training, playing, working, even in her appearance and her children. With every single thing she did, she did it at the best of her abilities."

Season: "But how would that explain her prodigy-like power?"

Celest: "When one goes over their limits, their potential increases-"

Season: *He tugged on his robes with impatience.* "I know simple things like that."

Celest: "Then explain it to me if thou're so familiar with it?"

Season: "When going over your maximum capacity, you become stronger-"

Celest: "Why?"

Season: "Because your limit increases over time."

Celest: "Pushing the limits is no saying. One literally pushes their limits further once exceeded."

Season: "Please explain, what has this got to do-?" *He stopped in mid-sentence and paused.*

Celest: (Did he just realise my point?)

Season: *He shook his head at himself with a slight smirk.* "I apologise. I'm slightly embarrassed I didn't figure it out sooner."

Celest: "As long as thou understand."

Season: "I do. You believe that she pushed her limits for every single thing she did?"

Celest: "And eventually, she was the result of that drive." *She nodded her head.* "But thy also believe she was naturally powerful, though."

Season: "Fascinating."

Celest: "Thou've spent several months in Valhalla researching Tarlea's history." *She looked to her side, watching Season admire the glyphic drawings.*

Season: "Of course. This type of information can't be found anywhere else."

Celest: "Thy see." *She whispered as her attention slowly drifted back to the wall.*

Season: "And what is this?" *He observed the wall and frowned, as if he didn't recognise the markings.*

Celest: "Yes. Thy wanted to show thou these."

Season: "Another artefact created by my mother?"

Celest: "No."

Season: *He paused and silently waited for Celest's response.* "Well, what are they?"

Celest: "These were the first written glyphs-.." *She whispered in amazement.*

Season: "Of?" *He leant forward in suspense.*

Celest: "The first glyphic symbols of the Radiatons, the affinity of light."

Season: *His eyes widened in shock, causing him to quickly glance at the glyphs in amazement.* "But there is no written formula on how Radiatons work."

Celest: "Exactly."

Season: "Why would you show me something so important?"

Celest: "..."

Season: (Despite not having Radiatons, if I memorise these glyphs and incorporate them to my use, then I'll be able to make hybrid versions of light-based Rostical!)

Celest: "Tarlea was amazing, but these glyphs weren't her doing."

Season: "O-Oh?" *He started to breathe heavily due to excitement.*

Celest: "These glyphs." *She placed her hand on the marble wall and ran her finger along the deep glyphic symbols.* "Were created by your father."

Season: *His jaw dropped in confusion.* "F-Father?"

Celest: "It's surprising thou haven't asked anything about him."

Season: "P-Please! Tell me all that you know." *His voice stuttered with excitement.*

*Teresa and Madora stood on top of a large lighthouse, admiring the landscape below.*

Madora: *Her long black hair flapped in the wind behind her.* "I always enjoyed the view from The Elemental Tower."

Teresa: "It is-" *She paused, flicking the curls of her long blonde hair out of her face.* "-Beautiful."

Madora: "Oh deary me. You're not wrong." *She chuckled as she continued to admire the scenery.*

Teresa: "What will you do now?"

Madora: "Oh?" *She looked and sounded surprised.* "I could ask you the same thing?"

Teresa: "Hoh?"

Madora: "Well, respect your elders." *She hinted for Teresa to answer first.*

Teresa: "Precisely." *She looked at Madora with respect and nodded her head.* "I wish to explore the unknown."

Madora: "So after all you've been through, you just want to travel?"

Teresa: "Not necessarily travel, but the idea of exploring new things-.." *She looked up to the sky with a confused smile.*

Madora: "Sounds like you enjoy exploring as a hobby."

Teresa: "A hobby? How tedious. It is preferable if it were stated as actions relating to educational purposes."

Madora: "Hmm? So, what brought on this fascination for educational purposes?"

Teresa: "When I explored four of the five Unknown Territories-" *She paused and thought how to word it.*

Madora: "Yes?"

Teresa: "The moment of not knowing what we would encounter was, exciting, thrilling-" *She stopped as soon as she realised how passionate she was getting, causing her to cough with an emotionless face.*

Madora: "Oh I understand."

Teresa: "What about you?" *She inhaled deeply and stood in a professional manner.*

Madora: "Well, I will be retiring of course."

Teresa: "Hoh?" *She instantly lost her composure, intensely staring at Madora with widening eyes.*

Madora: "This last ounce of excitement was enough for my old bones."

Teresa: "But, who will be in charge of the prophecies?!"

Madora: "Well-"

Teresa: "You can not leave the responsibilities that you have-"

Madora: "Teresa-"

Teresa: "Do you understand what could happen if you just retired! This is not-"

Madora: "Teresa."

Teresa: "If people dropped their responsibilities because an ounce of excitement detoured them away, then-"

Madora: "Terra Seraph!"

Teresa: *She looked startled and stopped.* "What?"

Madora: "I have chosen a predecessor to fill my position in."

Teresa: *She looked at Madora with dissatisfaction.* "Although that is better. Your responsibilities are far too great for just any person to fill in. Who is this person? I shall evaluate them immediately."

Madora: "You of course." *She smiled, as if it was a gift for Teresa.*

Teresa: "I desire to see this person now."

Madora: (She didn't even register what I said-) "I chose you as my predecessor."

Teresa: "I-? Me-?" *She looked shocked and stepped back.* "I believe the wind blew into my ears and I heard you incorrectly, who?"

Madora: "You."

Teresa: "I do not know."

Madora: "It was splendid when you told me about your thrill of discovering new things."

Teresa: "But, there is a large significance in difference between the two."

Madora: "What about the learning of future prophecies, events that have yet to pass in time's motion?"

Teresa: "Being a guardian of prophecies requires great power."

Madora: "Deary? Where are you going with this?"

Teresa: "You are the master of Astragons-"

Madora: "You are quite powerful yourself?" *She looked confused as if she didn't know where Teresa was going with the conversation.*

Teresa: "Indeed I am. But, the power of aurora, not even I can obtain such power."

Madora: *She chuckled, catching Teresa's attention.* "Did Ridley Enforcer not obtain aurora powers too?"

Teresa: "Yes.." *She spoke under her breath as if she wanted to ask Madora that question.*

Madora: "Aurorions is merely the power of light and dark."

Teresa: "Dark?" *She shook her head, frowning at Madora in confusion.* "How can darkness be part of the aurora power?!"

Madora: "Without light, you've got no life. And without darkness, you've got no soul. Both are needed to become whole."

Teresa: "Whole?" *She spoke under her breath, staring at Madora with widening eyes.* "N-Nevertheless, I do not see your point in telling me. I do not possess-"

Madora: *She waved her hand past Teresa's face, causing her eyes to shine gold.* "Radiatons?"

Teresa: "Tcch, I do not possess Shadiatons-"

Madora: "Why are you so offended by such a thing? Like I said before, power of light and dark is needed."

Teresa: "I will not allow darkness to consume my heart!"

Madora: "Oh, deary.. Remember the orb you kept for Joy?"

Teresa: "Orb?" *She sounded confused, suddenly triggering flashbacks of the black orb.* "Hoh?"

Madora: *She chuckled again, nodding her head for confirmation.* "Yes.."

Teresa: "Then?" *She looked at her hands with widening eyes.*

Madora: "You are the perfect candidate to take over from me."

Teresa: (Now that I think about it.. Did she plan this from the start?)

Madora: "What do you say, deary?"

Teresa: *She stared at her hands, smiling in thought.* (Without light, you've got no life. And without darkness, you've got no soul. Both are needed to become whole?)

Madora: "Well, what are your thoughts? Help a dear old friend out?"

Teresa: *She raised her arm and formed a fist, looking at Madora in confidence.* "Of course! I just calculated that I would be the best suitable person to do this."

Madora: *She discreetly smirked and placed her hand over Teresa's fist.* "Excellent-"

Teresa: "When will I start? Will there be training involved? What are the correct procedures for me to utilise-"

Madora: "We will begin whenever you're ready. I will personally train you with hands-on experience and I'll teach you those procedures as we go. Later, we will strengthen your dormant Shadiatons and begin the process of integration with your Radiatons. Mastery of each stage are steps closer to using Aurorions."

Teresa: "Then, I would like to start effective immediately."

Madora: "Great?! Ready?"

Teresa: "Of course-"

Madora: "Excellent-" *A swirl of aurora blurred the environment around her.*

Teresa: (I can not wait-) *She smiled as the aurora blew her hair to each side.* "I send you my gratitude."

Madora: "No, thank you."

*Teresa and Madora disappeared off the lighthouse in a flash of rainbow coloured light.*

*A massive crowd gathered around a large water fountain in front of Joy, Lupton and Chrisma.*

Lupton: "And stab!" *He poked himself in the chest, causing the crowd to gasp and lean back in shock.* "That's when she pierced me with her whip!"

Woman: *She held a baby in her arms, staring at Lupton with astonishment.* "You're strong! You deflected one of her attacks with your Pentarang!"

Lupton: "I do try!"

Girl: *She glanced at Joy.* "P-Pwease continue with the story where you encountered the number one!"

Joy: "I'll be happy to explain what happened." *She smiled and looked up with recollection.*

Man: *He sat on the stone ground with his legs crossed.* "Chrisma-"

Chrisma: "What is it, you little git?" *She groaned with a smile, giving him her attention.*

Man: "Tell us more about the other world." *He spoke in amazement, as a line of guys enthusiastically nodded their heads in agreement.*

Man: "Th-The dark liquid?"

Chrisma: "My love!"
Lupton: *He stood up with a smile.* "Lezard!"

Joy: "Wow-" *She spoke with a warm smile and slowly leant up onto her feet.* "It's fantastic to see you again."

*Pepper and Locki walked through a flowery meadow which visibly floated above the ocean.*

Pepper: "I hope this hasn't been an inconvenience to you, yeah?" *She looked at him worried.*

Locki: "Inconvenience? It's not often one's lover is the mistress of Radiatons." *He smirked in amazement, causing Pepper to smile.* "No person has survived a decapitation of their head before."

Pepper: *She nodded twice in agreement.* "We owe her a great deal."

Locki: "You have no idea."

Pepper: "Now that her power has started to become dormant, what will we do now?"

Locki: (The mistress' power becoming dormant, it started to happen once peace spread across the lands-)

Pepper: "I say, Locki?"

Locki: "Hmm?"

Pepper: "What should we do now?"

Locki: "Well, I had something in mind before.." *He stopped and turned his back on Pepper, as a warm breeze blew across the meadow.*

Pepper: "Before?"

Locki: "Before you were banished from Valhalla."

Pepper: *She stared at Locki's back before looking down to the swaying flowers.* "Speaking of such. Why did my body revert to a younger state?"

Locki: *He looked down and inhaled.* "Perhaps a result of your Radiatons being sealed?" *He sounded disappointed, catching Pepper's attention.*

Pepper: "Probably-" *She looked up, staring at Locki's back in confusion.* "I say, why do you sound disappointed?"

Locki: "Because, I wanted to reveal my plans to you."

Pepper: "Oh? Tell me, yeah?"

Locki: *He shuffled through his armour and robes.* "Well-"

Pepper: *She took several steps towards him, reaching out to touch his arm.* "Are you hiding something?"

Locki: "It was hard to craft this, but it took me a while." *He turned around, cupping his hands with a smile.*

Pepper: *She leant back slightly nervous.* "What is it, Locki?"

Locki: *He silently bowed to one knee and raised his arms.* "Will you marry me?" *He spread his hands and a crystal ring materialised in the air.*

Pepper: "H-Huh-?"

Locki: "This was crafted from the condensed sands of The Swirling Marshes, forged by the purest of Radiatons."

*Light flickered around the ring, causing rainbow coloured beams to shine in front of Locki.*

Pepper: *One of the beams shined on her face, causing her skin to glow different colours.* "L-Locki?"

Locki: "What is your answer?"

Pepper: "I say."

Locki: *His heart visibly pumped through his chest.* (The suspense!)

Pepper: "Yes."

Locki: *He laughed in amazement and reached up, gently grabbing the ring in one hand.* "May I?" *He looked at Pepper's hand then to the ring.*

Pepper: *She sighed in disbelief and reached out, presenting her hand to Locki.* "W-When did you intend to do this?" *She watched him elegantly slide the ring on her finger.*

Locki: "As I said, before you were banished." *He helped himself up and stepped closer to Pepper.*

Pepper: "Oh-"

Locki: "I love you, Pepper Captian."

Pepper: "I love you too, Locki-"

Locki: *He kissed her before she finished off her sentence.* (I've never been so happy.)

----------

*Alicia opened the screen door and took a deep satisfying sigh, stepping inside the house.*

Kairi: "Oh? Alicia, is that you?" *She opened the oven and checked the roast, causing the aroma to fill the kitchen.*

Alicia: "Y-Yep."

Kairi: "How were the kids at work today?"

Alicia: "They were great." *She smiled and hobbled towards the couch.* "The staff handed out the childcare awards today."

Kairi: "Oh? How did it go?" *She smiled and closed the oven, walking towards the sink.*

Alicia: "Well, they wanted to give me all the awards, so it was a little awkward."

Kairi: "Hehe, did they?"

Alicia: "Yep. I'm really excited about the progress the children are making."

Kairi: "I'm really happy with the progress you're making."

Alicia: "Oh, what do you mean?"

Kairi: "Well, you've only been caring for the children for a few months and you're already been regarded as one of the best."

Alicia: *She smiled and sat down in the chair.* "I'm just happy I get to do what I enjoy."

Kairi: "Well, it's good that you happen to enjoy children. You'll be having your own in a few months."

Alicia: *She looked down and rubbed her bulging belly.* "Y-Yep." *She bit her bottom lip in excitement and touched the remote, turning on the TV.*

Kairi: "So, Alicia."

Alicia: "Yes?"

Kairi: "Lance has been very secretive about what you're going to name him." *She hinted as she started to wash up the dishes.*

Alicia: "S-Sorry, can't tell you. I promised him."

Kairi: *She lowered her head to the sink and chuckled.* "Okay, okay. I respect that."

Alicia: "Tee hee, yep-" *She looked down in shock, causing her to quickly place her hand on her belly.* "He just kicked."

Kairi: "Sounds like he's going to be a strong boy."

Alicia: "Y-Yes." *She spoke with a smile.*

Anchor Man: "And here comes Lance Lighten!" *The man's voice drew Alicia's attention towards the TV.*

Alicia: "M-Mum, Lance is on."

Kairi: *She quickly walked out of the kitchen and stared at the TV.* "Turn it up." *She spoke in excitement, drying a plate with a cloth.*

Alicia: "R-Right." *She quickly pushed the buttons on the remote, turning up the volume.*

Anchor Man: "And the conclusion of Lance's current case has just finished. If any of you don't know already, Lance has become one of the best lawyers in the state. We will find out the results after these testimonials." *The screen changed shot to a young teenager.*

Boy: "I-If it wasn't for Lance, I would still be school-less."

Anchor Man: *He nodded his head and stepped closer, holding the microphone up.* "Please care to explain what he did?"

Boy: "Well. I've been picked on by this bully for some time."

Anchor Man: "But don't we all?"

Boy: *He awkwardly paused in response.* "Well, the last straw was when his friend's video recorded the bully punching me in the face for no reason."

Anchor Man: "Hm hm." *He nodded his head.*

Boy: "And, I decided to defend myself after months of discrimination."

Anchor Man: "Discrimination?"

Boy: "Because of my larger size." *He looked down, causing the shot to reveal his large posture.*

Anchor Man: "Oh yes, please continue."

Boy: "Well, after I fought back. I ended up getting suspended too. No schools would accept me due to the evidence of me fighting back. So, Lance fought for me, and told the high council my side of the story."

Anchor Man: *He looked to the screen and inhaled.* "And after Lance's help, this young teenager was able to get re-enrolled into the school district department."

Boy: "Thank you, Lance!"

Anchor Man: "And there you have it, just one of Lance Lighten's many cases!"

Alicia: (Lance..) *She smiled, watching the screen switch back to the courthouse.*

Anchor Man: "Now, this case was one of Lance's heaviest trials, as it impacted a large number of people. To keep you updated, this case is involving child abuse." *He turned around and watched a growing crowd gather in front of the courthouse.*

Kairi: "This is a big one." *She looked worried and sat on the arm of the chair next to Alicia.*

Alicia: *She enthusiastically nodded her head in agreement.* "Once Lance found out about the cases of children being abused in carers, schools or even at homes, he looked at me and said he had to do something about it."

Kairi: *She smiled proudly.* "If he wins or loses this case, I'm happy for him."

Alicia: "Even the awareness brought forth from this case could create massive change to the way things are done."

Kairi: "Definitely."

Anchor Man: "News just in-" *He looked up and placed his hand on his ear, as if he was listening through an earpiece.* "It seems, Lance has won another case!"

*The crowd behind him cheered and raised signs above their heads in excitement.*

Anchor Man: "And-" *He turned around and watched Lance storm out of the courthouse, dressed in an expensive looking suit.* "Here he is!"

Lance: *He walked straight up to the Anchor Man, keeping a professional-like composure.* "Yes?"

Anchor Man: "Please tell the public what happened?"

Lance: "This case was unique. I wasn't up against a specific person, but, I fought for an idea."

Anchor Man: "Oh? How does this relate to child abuse?"

Lance: "The issue is-"

Kairi: "It was a huge adjustment for me when I transferred here with Leon." *She softly spoke to Alicia while reading the subtitles from Lance's interview.*

Alicia: "What suddenly brought this up?" *She spoke with respect without looking away from the screen.*

Kairi: "With my grandson on the way, I'm just envious how well you've settled in."

Alicia: "It's been quite a few years, right? Of course, I would have settled by now."

Kairi: "It took me many years to adjust to this world. Without using my wind abilities, it's like when you've torn a muscle, you don't realise how often you use it until it's inaccessible."

Alicia: "I've got Lance."

Kairi: "I had Leon, there shouldn't be much of a difference between-"

Alicia: "Tee hee." *Her giggle interrupted Kairi's sentence.*

Kairi: "What is it?"

Alicia: "There's a huge difference between our experiences." *She spoke with a smile and rested her arms on her belly.*

Kairi: *She glanced at Alicia before focusing back to the screen.* "And that is?"

Alicia: "I don't only have Lance, but I also have you to guide me."

Kairi: *She smiled and leant to the side, placing her hand on top of Alicia's.* "Thank you so much. You've got a really beautiful energy, you know that-?"

Anchor Man: "Wow, simply amazing-" *He glanced back to the screen.* "That was Lance Lighten for you."

Lance: "No worries." *He nodded his head and readied to walk out of shot.*

Anchor Man: *He quickly faced Lance and stepped forward.* "What have you got next?"

Lance: *He stopped and lowered his head to the microphone.* "The next few cases of interest, are those with disorders or problems which are stereotypically overlooked."

Anchor Man: "I know you're in a hurry, but you mind letting us quickly know?"

Lance: "For example, I came across a young woman who had an addiction."

Anchor Man: "An addiction?"

Lance: "Details are not important, but she did the right thing and started undergoing counselling."

Anchor Man: "Yes?" *He spoke with uncertainty, slowly nodding his head.*

Lance: "But, the government that funds the program encountered a problem, which resulted in the institution closing down."

Anchor Man: "What happened to this woman?"

Lance: "She eventually satisfied her addiction, causing her to lose her home and loved ones."

Anchor Man: "I see, looks like another hard case to take on."

Lance: "If it isn't hard, then it's not worth it." *He nodded his head.* "Thank you for having me." *He looked past the screen and started to walk away.*

Kairi: *She jumped up in excitement.* "He won!"

Alicia: "I knew he could do it."

Kairi: (My little boy has grown so much. My young man-) *She glanced at Alicia with a caring smile.* (I really feel like these two will have a bright future ahead of them.)

Chapter 27: Tales of The Rostical Users

*Melinda walked into a massive library, catching the entire staffs' attention.*

Staff Member: "M-Melinda, ma'am."

Melinda: *She smiled, glancing across the library.* "So this is where I'll be having my interview?"

Manager: *She leant back in a chair, shouting out from a manager's office.* "Is Melinda Hambridge, the renown meteorologist-"

Melinda: "Yes, she's here." *She spoke with a chuckle, causing the staff members to smile.*

Manager: *She gasped and quickly ran out of the manager's office, looking at Melinda in amazement.* "Mrs Hambridge! It's an honour to have you here."

Melinda: "It's an honour to be here."

Manager: "The news network will be here within the hour, would you like to go over the interview questions?"

Melinda: "Of course."

Manager: *She waved her hand to a pre-made interview set, making her way towards a couch.* "How does it feel to become one of the world's most renown meteorologists at the age of twenty-five?"

Melinda: "I can thank my mother's support. Some of my fondest memories is working alongside her."

Manager: "How does it feel to discover a new element to physics?"

Melinda: "I'm assuming we're talking about Sceldrant's Comet?"

Manager: "Yes. It was you and your mother that discovered this."

Melinda: "Well-"

*Twortz stormed into a two storey Fast Food Enterprise store, instantly catching the store manager's attention.*

Store Manager: "Twortz!"

Twortz: *She smiled in response, greeting him with a professional nod of her head.* "Hello."

Twortz: "I finished training up this season of managers, so I'm following up on my own stores."

Store Manager: "Of course." *He stepped to the side, pointing at a small elevator next to a set of stairs.* "Please, let's discuss this in the café section?"

Twortz: "That sounds excellent."

Twortz: "Yes?"

Store Manager: "How did you manage to become so successful?"

Twortz: "I dream."

Store Manager: "D-Dream?"

Twortz: "Those who don't dream will never surpass their own expectations."

Store Manager: "Nahaha, this is fascinating."

Store Manager: "I also hear the Hapkido dojo is becoming rather successful!"

Twortz: "Let's go through what we need first, then I can answer your questions."

Tyler: *He pointed across Battling Oxident, nodding his head at several workers.* "Excellent-"

Tyler: "O-Okay." *He nervously squealed, causing Ginger to giggle.*

PKMY: *She shouted and pointed to each side, causing warriors to help carry items out of a burning house.* "Evacuate the people, then we will deal with the house!"

PKMY: "Excellent." *She smirked, watching the fire splinter in the breeze.*

?????: "Ma'am!"

Captain: "What would you like me to do?"

Captain: *He smirked and nodded his head, facing the burning house.* "Power of the deep depths, let my power swirl throughout your spirit-"

*The captain raised his arms and watched a pool of water materialise in the air.*

Captain: *He looked up, staring at the forming pool of water with widening eyes.* "Summon the ocean's pressure and feast on the sacred waters-"

*The pool of water formed into a large whale, causing it to moan in a whale-like manner.*

Captain: "WHALE DIVIDER" *He lowered his arms, causing the whale to dive directly on top of the burning house.*

*The whale exploded into a massive pulse of waves, extinguishing all the flames.*

Warrior: *He stood next to PKMY, gasping in amazement.* "I can't wait to become as strong as him. Then I'd be able to protect my village."

PKMY: "Anything is possible."

Warrior: "A-Anything?" *He spoke as if he was relating it to his dream.*

*Holland ran after a young teenager, deep inside an ancient forest.*

*Teresa and Madora looked at their reflections in the water fountain, watching the water ripple aurora colours.*

Teresa: "Hoh?"

Madora: *She smiled, observing Teresa's facial expressions.* "What did you think?"

Teresa: *She leant back, staring at Madora in a dumbfounded manner.* "What did I just experience?"

Madora: "Your first prophecy."

Teresa: "Hoh?"

Madora: "You've successfully integrated both Radiatons and Shadiatons into your being, allowing you to access the power of Aurorions."

Teresa: "It is intriguing. Having the knowledge of Shadiatons and Aurorions. Why not make it common knowledge?"

Madora: "Some things are better not said."

Teresa: *She nodded her head in understanding, glancing back to the pedestal.* "So-.."

Madora: "What did you see?"

Teresa: "A prophecy involving something called The Dontalia Facility?" *She shrugged her shoulders, as if she didn't know what it was.*

Madora: "What are your thoughts?"

Teresa: "This is the type of knowledge I have always been fascinated to learn." *She smiled, facing Madora in appreciation.* "I thank you, Madora."

Madora: "Oh, deary me. You'll make me blush."

Teresa: "My words are true to their meaning, Madora."

Madora: "Knowing someone like you is monitoring over the prophecies. I'll be able to finally retire."

Teresa: "Despite your intentions, have I learned everything I need to know?"

Madora: "Everything." *She smiled and closed her eyes, alerting Teresa.*

Teresa: "Madora?"

Madora: "I leave everything in your care, Terra Seraph." *Strings of aurora light swirled around her, blowing her hair to each side.*

Teresa: "I understand. Enjoy your retirement, my good friend."

Madora: "..." *She suddenly disappeared in a swirl of aurora coloured light.*

Teresa: *She looked up and smiled, staring at the sky.* "Thank you.."

*Alicia and a young boy played in a flowery bed, listening to birds chirp in the distance.*

Alicia: *She giggled and swayed to the side, causing her long blue dress to gracefully sway in the warm breeze.* "I wasn't as fast when I was your age."

Boy: "Ahaha-" *He stopped in mid-giggle, watching butterflies flap past him.*

Alicia: "What did?" *She faced Lance, holding her hat with one hand in confusion.*

Lance: "Our parting gift?"

Alicia: *She gasped in amazement, cupping her pendant with both hands.* "R-Really?"

Boy: *He giggled, chasing after a white butterfly around the flowery bed.* "Ahahaha."

Lance: *He hopped down several steps, admiring the boy run in the flowery meadow.* "Be careful, my little butt nugget."

Boy: "Tee hee, okies, dad!"

Alicia: *She elegantly sat down and looked up, watching Lance walk towards her.* "What did you think triggered it?"

Lance: *He kissed Alicia on the head and bent down, sitting in the flowers in front of her.* "I was just thinking of all our adventures."

Alicia: "No matter how busy I find myself, I always wonder what everyone is up to."

Alicia: *She held Lance on the side of his head and leant forward, kissing him with a smile.* "Ready when you are."

Lance: "Oi, I may be all mature ‘n' stuff now, but you're the one that still does this stuff." *He spoke with a smile and looked at the ruby as if he had no idea how to work it.*

Alicia: (Activated by emotions-) *She cupped her hands over Lance's around the ruby and closed her eyes, causing a swirl of wind to blow the flowers around them.*

Boy: "Come back here!" *He squealed with a giggle, continuing to chase after the butterfly.*

*Lance and Alicia gasped and placed their hands on the ground, trying to regain their composure.*

Lance: "W-Whoa-"
Alicia: "W-Wow-.." *They looked at each other with watering eyes.*

Lance: "I love you so much, Alicia Lighten."

Alicia: "I love you too."

Boy: "Mum, dad? Is everyfing okay?!" *He skipped through the flowers, noticing their exhausted facial expressions.*

Lance: "We're fine, my young man." *He reached out and grabbed the boy around the waist, purposely pulling him onto his lap.*

Boy: *He squealed, trying to get out of Lance's grip.* "Ahaha, what's wrong?"

Lance: "It's nothin'."

Alicia: "We'll show you when you're a little older."

Boy: *He leant up, looking at Alicia in a serious manner.* "Why not now, mum?"

Alicia: "There's too much violence."

Boy: "I'm five, I'ma man-"

Lance: "A man? You can't even eat ya veggies." *He sighed and purposely looked away, causing Alicia to giggle.*

Boy: "But, but-"

Lance: "I'm gonna need the help when you get older, so eat your veggies, they'll help ya get stronger."

Boy: "OK!" *He smiled with a missing tooth.*

Lance: "We love ya, Ash."
Alicia: "We love you, Ashton." *They unintentionally spoke at the same time.*

Ashton: "I love you too, mum and dad, aha." *He watched the butterfly flap past him, causing him to giggle and chase after it again.*

Lance: "Watch out for the bees, Ash!"

Ashton: "Yes, dad!"

Alicia: "Lunch will be ready shortly." *She smiled at Ashton, readying herself to stand up.*

Ashton: "Yes, mum!"

Lance: *He quickly stood up and reached down, helping Alicia onto her feet.* "Man, it was pretty crazy back then."

Alicia: "And we only watched a portion of it."

Lance: "We did?"

Alicia: "Yep." *She smiled, holding Lance's hand.*

Lance: "Who would've thought-" *He sighed and looked up, staring at the clear blue sky.*

Alicia: "W-What?" *She spoke with a smile, keeping a discreet eye on Ashton.*

Lance: "That happily ever afters were real."

*Teresa, PKMY, Pepper, Tyler, Holland, Freya and Season sat on differently-shaped rocks on a floating island.*

*Long vibrant grass swayed in the constant warm breeze and the smell of flowers filled the air.*

Tyler: *He covered his mouth in amazement.* "That's fantastic."

PKMY: "Pssht, it would be more like, I'm such an annoyin' try hard."

Tyler: "Ha ha."
Season: "Hohoho."

PKMY: "Heheheh."
Tyler: "Hahahaha."
Holland: "Haha haha haha."

Season: "I'll give it to him on his birthday."

Tyler: "Oh-" *He snapped his fingers, looking at the party in excitement.*

Tyler: "Ha ha, no. I just wanted to let you all know, that we're three weeks away from another Battling Oxident, I hope to see you all there."

Season: "I'll definitely be there."

Tyler: "Ha ha."

PKMY: "Count me in!" *She smirked and punched the air in front of her.*

Tyler: "I will post the memo to the Consultant-" *He smiled at PKMY.* "And let you know the times closer to the date."

Season: "Excellent-"

*An aurora swirl pulsed around Teresa and alerted her, causing the party to silently stare at her.*

Teresa: "I see." *She sighed and jumped off the rock.* "It is time for me to leave-"

Tyler: *His watch-like bangle started to ring, causing him to whine in a disappointed manner.* "I've got to go back to the city too-"

*A heartbeat-like pulse thumped through PKMY and Freya, alerting them of something.*

Freya: *She stood up and glanced at PKMY, as she nodded her head.* "We've got to go too."

Holland: *He closed his eyes and deeply inhaled.* "I'm currently needed back at my tribe-"

*The party stood motionless and looked each other, causing them to instantaneously smile.*

Teresa: (It saddens me that I will not see my party-) *She paused in thought.* (Friends, for quite some time-)

Season: "One for the journey?" *He spread his arms with a warm smile.*

PKMY: "Until next time-"

Pepper: "I say, which will be Battling Oxident, yeah?"

Holland: "Yeah." *He mumbled with a smirk.*

*Teresa, PKMY, Season, Holland, Tyler and Pepper took several steps forward and hugged.*

PKMY: *She smiled with her eyes closed.* "When did we all get so needy for each other? It's only bloody three weeks."

Teresa: "Indeed." *She spoke with a warm smile as if she didn't care.*

Freya: *She trotted in the middle of the party and leant against their legs, symbolising a hug.* (I couldn't have asked to be in a better pack than this.)

Madora: *She watched the party from a nearby floating island, hidden in cotton-like clouds.* (These bright individuals, I foresaw a beautiful future in all of them.) *She smiled, watching the party disappear in flashes of white, purple and aurora coloured light.*

###

Michael: "Good flaming gravy, you made it! Thank you very much for reading! Without you, I honestly would not have made it so far!"

Lezard: "The ending! Who else doesn't feel happy and sad that it has finally ended?"

Michael: "It's been a long and satisfying adventure! So thank you so much for reading this much! Please leave us a review on how you think the ending was? Was it good? Bad-?"

Lezard: "It was bad! Why did Lance want to go back to his world?!"

Michael: "He didn't have a choice?"

Lezard: "Well.. It feels like it's missing something!"

Michael: "What about the epilogue chapter?"

Lezard: "What epilogue chapter? Lezard needs to find it!"

Michael: *He coughed and rolled his eyes.* "If you have any questions, feel free to send me an email. I'm also on Facebook and Twitter! I find any feedback scrumptious and I will always reply back. Hope to hear from you, little silly sausage! And I-, no! We hope you enjoyed this series! It has taken me more than ten years to complete both Rostical series. I honestly hope you enjoyed my life's work and at the time writing this, I hope one day it'll be an amazing JRPG or anime that hopefully teaches good morals or guidance to those that need it! Please check out the extras and credits! Thank you."

- Michael. R.

Chapter 01: Character BIO

Name: Lance Lighten.

Age: 21.

Hair: Medium and messy, bed-like hair. Hair goes to his forehead and around his ears. Hair spikes out. Hair appears oily and is not affected by weak wind. No hairstyle. Length, two months worth of growth. His hair has an appearance of a porcupine.

Hair Colour: Dark brown.

Face: No facial hair, no wrinkles. Symmetrical facial features. When showing emotion, his eyes and upper nose wrinkles up. White teeth. His voice is normal, not high or low.

Eye Colour: Light brown.

Body Build: Medium body build, chest slightly puffed. Has slender arms and a toned belly.

Body Attributes: No body hair (Legs, arms, chest, stomach, back etc).

Height: 175cm.

Garment: PKMY's uniform. Long sleeved, leathered shirt and pants. Acquired bangle on left wrist. Several glyphs are patterned underneath the sleeves of his arms. Wears Alicia's lunar shaped pendant.

Favourite Weapon: Lightning sword.

Battle Type: Offensive, front lines. Has comparable physical and Rostical offence.

Favourite food: Watermelon.

Habits: Has his own way of speaking. Unable to express himself the way he wants.

Personality: Arrogant, rude, care free, loud, respectful, childish, trustworthy.

Attributes: Ashton's best friend. Often misunderstood when he has good intentions.

Be warned as the following may contain spoilers.

Background:
--

Class: Swordsman. Rostical User. Elementalist.

Rostical: Affinity: Lightning
"Smear upon the skies, blue waves crashing down, LIGHTNING BLAST"
"Flash of the storm, smear upon the skies, blue waves crashing down, chain reaction, LIGHTNING CHAIN BLAST"
"Lightning strike both sides, flashing and flowing, call upon the secrets, summon the beast of roaring thunder, DRAGON'S BREATH"
"Roar with the skies might, THUNDER BOOM"
"Smear upon the skies and envelop your might, thunder roar down, LIGHTNING PULSE"
"There's a spark in no time, let your colours burst and shine, allow your existence to fade, NIGHTSHADE"
"Vibrating molecules, heat, expand, repel, MAGNETIC RUMBLE"
Grand Rostical:
"Untouchable flames, splinter from the divine spirit, burning courage engrave my immense power, scorch thout foe, PHOENIX BLASTER"
Azure:
"Forty five, Streaming Sword."
"Twenty nine, Air Slash."
Ougi:
"Blasted shit nuggets, Subzero Volt."
- Cloud-nine Volt
- Zero-volt Blender
"Brazza's Supreme Strobe Light Storm."
Hi-Ougi:
+ Alicia "Power of the deep depths, let our power roar like thunder, and shatter like ice, heed our words, summon the soothing aqua, move and flow with the spirits that borrow your power, ETHEREAL RAPIDS"
+ Alicia "Streaming sword, Icicle Stroke, Ice-chain Claymores."

All character statistics are shown from their last appearance in the book.

Attack - The character's physical strength. Rostical assisted attacks greatly increases strength.
Defence - Natural defensive capabilities, determines how many critical hits character can receive.
Neurons - Determines the raw power of character's Rostical.
Astragons - Determines the character's manipulation of space/width their Rostical consumes.
Rostical - Character's natural ability at using Rostical.
Speed - Character's running speed, also determines the speed of a flashstep.
Agility - Character's manoeuvrability, ability to avoid projectiles and strikes.
Technique - Character's strengths at using special skills, Azures, Ougi, etc.
Intelligence - High intelligence may prevent stupidity.
Ability - Character's given ability, self-explanatory.

Statistics:
Attack: A
Defence: B
Neurons: A++
Astragons: A+
Rostical: A++
Speed: A
Agility: C+
Technique: A-
Intelligence: C+
Ability: A

After feeling Holland's heartbeat reach critical, she drew out all her Neurons and Astragons and released her future potential. Ability: S++



Name: Pepper 'Angler' Captian (Vanheart).

Age: 25. (In appearance).

Hair: Long, finishes near her lower back. She ties it into two ponytails on each side, which travels across her ears and down to her side.

Hair Colour: Blonde.

Face: She has several glyphic markings around her eyes which faintly glow, only in the heat of battle. Average sounding voice.

Eye Colour: Gold.

Body Build: Slender, large shoulders.

Body Attributes: No body hair.

Height: 155cm.

Garment: Wears shiny white vest, white shiny skirt with tight sport shorts underneath. Wears golden bracelets on each hand. Red orbs used to hold her hair up. She materialised a pair of blue goggles, which she wears of her forehead.

Favourite Weapon: Mallet / Aura.

Battle Type: Offensive.

Favourite Food: Unknown.

Habits: Condescending.

Personality: Emotionless, power, ultimate being.

Attributes: Often goes into her own world, where she loses all attention and loses her presence to the party. Her fighting capabilities are that of a powerful being. She has no memory of her past, but she has flashbacks when she spends more time with the party.

Be warned as the following may contain spoilers.
